org.apache.mesos.offer

Class AttributeStringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.mesos.offer.AttributeStringUtils

  • public class AttributeStringUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Tools for converting Attributes into strings. Spec is defined by Mesos documentation at: http://mesos.apache.org/documentation/latest/attributes-resources/

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String toString(Attribute attribute)
      Converts the provided attribute into a string which follows the format defined by Mesos: attributes : attribute ( ";" attribute )* attribute : text ":" ( scalar | range | text ) text : [a-zA-Z0-9_/.-] scalar : floatValue floatValue : ( intValue ( "." intValue )? ) | ...
      static java.lang.String toString(java.util.List<Attribute> attributes)
      Converts the provided list of zero or more attributes into a string suitable for parsing by #parseString(String).
      static java.util.List<java.lang.String> toStringList(java.lang.String joinedAttributes) 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • toStringList

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> toStringList(java.lang.String joinedAttributes)

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(java.util.List<Attribute> attributes)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts the provided list of zero or more attributes into a string suitable for parsing by #parseString(String).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if some part of the provided attributes couldn't be serialized

      • toString

        public static java.lang.String toString(Attribute attribute)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts the provided attribute into a string which follows the format defined by Mesos: attributes : attribute ( ";" attribute )* attribute : text ":" ( scalar | range | text ) text : [a-zA-Z0-9_/.-] scalar : floatValue floatValue : ( intValue ( "." intValue )? ) | ... intValue : [0-9]+ range : "[" rangeValue ( "," rangeValue )* "]" rangeValue : scalar "-" scalar set : "{" text ( "," text )* "}" NOTE that it is difficult if not impossible to consistently perform the inverse of this operation. For example, how can you tell if something is supposed to be a SCALAR value or a TEXT value? [0-9.]+ is valid in both cases! Your best hope is to consistently convert to string, and then convert strings...
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if some part of the provided attributes couldn't be serialized
